title: Common
description: Common definitions used in multiple schemas.

TimeStamp.description: A single instant in time specified to arbitrary precision.

seconds.description: Seconds as a float, to allow representing fractional seconds

Point.description: A location on the field, specified from some arbitrary reference point.

xLocation.description: Distance from the origin along the x-axis in meters.

yLocation.description: Distance from the origin along the y-axis in meters.

height.description: Height above the origin, also in meters.

isRelative.description: Whether this position is relative to the robot, or to some external origin (e.g. the robot's starting point)

PathSpec.description: A series of control points that are interpolated to define a straight or curved line segment.

interpolType.description: The interpolation type used to join the points.
